location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 5/8 Attempt by Persian Government to Take Over Lighting and Buoying of the Persian Gulf'

physicalDescription.extent: This file is arranged approximately in chronological order.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 6; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between the following: Captain Everard Huddleston Gastrell, officiating British Political Agent at Bahrain; Lieutenant-Colonel Percy Gordon Loch, British Political Resident in the Persian Gulf at Bushire; Lieutenant Colonel Harold Richard Patrick Dickson, British Political Agent at Kuwait; and Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, the Adviser to the Government of Bahrain.The correspondence concerns the landing of the Persian [Iranian] gunboat Palangat Hengam island with a Frenchman on board claiming to have been sent from France to assist Persia [Iran] in taking over and running lighting and bouying in the Persian Gulf.
